intro: Haworthia tessellata var. palhinhiae, commonly known as the "Striped Haworthia," is a compact, rosette-forming succulent native to South Africa. It features a distinctive appearance with dark green, fleshy leaves that have prominent white to pale yellow stripes. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange during the warmer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it ideal for rock gardens or indoor cultivation. Its unique markings and compact size make it a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
